function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Circulation of the questionnaire on social media platforms may lead to a lack of representativeness in the respondent sample, risking biased results.","Impact":"Inaccurate findings may lead to incorrect conclusions about the effects of social media use during the COVID-19 pandemic.","Mitigation":"Implement random sampling and targeted outreach to ensure a more representative and diverse respondent sample.","Technologies":"Social media algorithms for targeted outreach, survey tools for random sampling.","People":"Survey respondents, researchers, and organizations conducting the study.","Owner":"Researchers, organizations conducting the study."},{"Description":"High frequency of social media use for following recent news may lead to exposure to misinformation and rumors about COVID-19.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading misinformation and false news, leading to public confusion and panic.","Mitigation":"Promote fact-checking and critical thinking skills, and provide accurate information sources.","Technologies":"Fact-checking tools, algorithms for detecting misinformation, educational resources.","People":"Social media users, general public.","Owner":"Public health organizations, media outlets, social media platforms."},{"Description":"High reliance on social media for communication and decision making may lead to echo chambers and confirmation bias, influencing public perception of COVID-19.","Impact":"Confirmation bias may lead to polarized and uninformed public opinion, hindering effective public health measures.","Mitigation":"Promote diverse sources of information, critical thinking, and cross-platform communication.","Technologies":"Cross-platform communication tools, algorithms promoting diverse content, educational resources.","People":"Social media users, general public.","Owner":"Public health organizations, social media platforms, media outlets."}]}
